title: Five UK firms make list of world's 100 most innovative companies
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Thu, Aug 20, 2015, 00:02 BST - UK Markets open in 7 hrs 58 mins Five UK firms make list of world's 100 most innovative companies By Elizabeth Anderson | Telegraph – 6 hours ago 84.48 -0.71 
Cambridge-based Arm Holdings (LSE: ARM.L - news ) takes fifth place in Forbes' ranking of world's top 100 companies, but there are no other UK firms in top 50 
Just five British companies have made Forbes' list of the World's Most Innovative Companies , and only one made the top 50. Arm Holdings, the Cambridge-based chip designer whose technology is used in almost all of the world's smartphones, took fifth place in the publication's ranking of 100 firms across the world. 
Arm, which is worth $12.9bn (£8.3bn), had sales growth of 17.5pc in the past 12 months. The FTSE 100 company recently reported a 22pc increase in quarterly revenue to £228.5m, although there have been warnings the firm's growth may level off because of a slowdown in the smartphone sector . 
Consumer goods giant Reckitt Benckiser (Xetra: A0M1W6 - news ) , worth $66.5bn, was the second UK company to make the list, coming in at 53. 
The company, which owns brands including Durex and Nurofen, has benefited from a boost in sales among its non-prescription cold and flu medicines. However, the firm was told by the UK Competition and Markets Authority that it would have to license out the K-Y lubricant brand it is buying from US giant Johnson & Johnson (NYSE: JNJ - news ) , to overcome worries the deal will lead to rising prices. 
Forbes ranked companies by their innovation premium: the difference between their market capitalisation and a net present value of cash flows from existing businesses. To be included, firms needed seven years of public financial data and a market cap of at least $10bn. 
Outsourcer Capita, credit checker Experian (Other OTC: EXPGF - news ) , and medical equipment manufacturer Smith & Nephew (LSE: SN.L - news ) were the three remaining UK companies that made the top 100. 
Forbes said US-based electric car maker Tesla Motors (Xetra: A1CX3T - news ) has grabbed Apple (NasdaqGS: AAPL - news ) 's creative crown. Tesla, which was named the World's Most Innovative Company 2015, is on track to gross $5.5bn this year, up 54pc from 2014, said the authors. Tesla's shares have soared 15-fold since it floated in 2010 to a recent $33bn market capitalisation. 
The company, which makes luxury all-electric vehicles, is run by Elon Musk, the tech billionaire that also runs SpaceX. 
Forbes Most Innovative Companies, top 10: *Tesla Motors, innovation score - 84.82 *Salesforce, innovation score - 77.81 *Alexion Pharmaceuticals (NasdaqGS: ALXN - news ) , innovation score - 72.50 *Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (NasdaqGS: REGN - news ) , innovation score - 72.13 *ARM Holdings, innovation score - 69.76 *Unilever Indonesia, innovation score - 67.90 *INCYTE Corporation (NasdaqGS: INCY - news ) , innovation score - 67.85 *Amazon, innovation score - 67.64 *Under Armour (Xetra: U9R.DE - news ) , innovation score - 66.56 *Biomarin Pharmaceutical (NasdaqGS: BMRN - news ) , innovation score - 65.19
